instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.3V3_S0: What is 3V3_S0? Abbreviation for PP3V3_S0, a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (25mA with a quick flash of 100mA)  Flying Blind!
threads.message:
This board is Tricky for me.  The flash of 100mA is caused by the brief 1/10 sec turn on of <CHIP>U3900</CHIP>.  <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> is on for just a split second and no thermal signatures out of the normal are detected. 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> is never present during this cycle.  
25 Mhz clock is present
3V3 enable flashes but only to 0.5v along the same time line as <CHIP>U3900</CHIP>.

I feel like a newbie asking for help on this board.   But I am flat stuck.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (25mA with a quick flash of 100mA)  Flying Blind!
threads.message:
Diode mode to ground on <SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL> rail?
Check for pulse with o-scope.
It can also show if enable signal reaches 3V peak...
